summary: Turkey hit by 7.8 magnitude earthquake on Monday, 22,000 dead. President Erdoğan facing critical questions over government's handling of disaster. Tens of thousands injured, hundreds of thousands homeless. Opposition leader Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu attacking Erdoğan head-on. Inadequate precautions taken by government leading to high fatalities. Erdoğan promises to rebuild destroyed cities and towns in 12 months despite economic crisis. Critics suspect Erdoğan not the right man to lead country into future.
